meanings.definition: To remove toxic substances from (a person or animal)
meanings.sent1: She detoxified her body by drinking lots of water.
meanings.sent2: The doctor detoxified the patient's system after the poisoning.
meanings.sent3: After the party, she detoxified her system with a healthy smoothie.
meanings.sent4: The cleaning crew detoxified the contaminated area with special chemicals.
meanings.sent5: The environmentalist worked hard to detoxify the polluted river.

meanings.definition: To undergo a process of removing toxic substances
meanings.sent1: The patient had to detoxify before the surgery.
meanings.sent2: The polluted water source needed to be detoxified for safe consumption.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to detoxify the crime scene to find evidence.
meanings.sent4: The company decided to detoxify its products to be more eco-friendly.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to detoxify the kitchen after the food poisoning incident.

meanings.definition: Having undergone a process of removing toxic substances
meanings.sent1: The detoxified water was safe to drink.
meanings.sent2: The detoxified patient felt much better after the treatment.
meanings.sent3: The detoxified air in the room smelled fresh and clean.
meanings.sent4: The detoxified soil was ready for planting new crops.
meanings.sent5: The detoxified animal showed signs of improved health.
